(Simplified: 钽)
Chinese Definition:
①一種金屬元素。用來製造蒸發器皿等，也可做電子管的電極、整流器、電解、電容。醫療上用來製成薄片或細線，縫補破壞的組織。

鉭字的基本解释

鉭
tǎn
见“钽”。

鉭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tǎn］
“钽1”的繁体字。
金属元素，符号Ta。银白色。有超导电性（－268.8℃时）和延展性，抗酸、抗碱性能都很强。用来制造蒸发器皿等，也用来制造电子管中的电极。还能单方向导电，可以制造整流器。钽对人体内部组织没有刺激作用，医疗上用来制成薄片或细线，缝补破坏的组织。

Tantalum
Basic explanation of words
Tantalum
tǎn
See "tantalum".
Tantalum
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tǎn］
Traditional characters for "tantalum 1".
Metal element, symbol Ta. silver white. It has superconductivity (-268.8℃) and ductility, and has strong acid and alkali resistance. Used to make evaporating vessels, etc., and also to make electrodes in electron tubes. It can also conduct electricity in one direction, and a rectifier can be manufactured. Tantalum has no stimulating effect on the internal tissues of the human body. It is medically used to make thin sheets or thin threads to repair damaged tissues.
